svg:

1. Global Readonly Immutable State - Encapsulation - objects own their state, keep it private, and other objects can only get at that state by using the public interface of that object. - _balance is hidden. - getBalance(), deposit(), withdraw() - Accurately project the application state - get it from the global state (Store) - Provide affordances through with the user can interact (cause a state transition) - we describe what happened as an "event" - a thing that happened. - we call this an "Action" - and just announce it.2. Function that everytime something happens (an action), it gets that action, and the current state of the application, and it can create a new (next) state. - This is called for weird reasons the "reducer" function. Don't worry about that. - the current value of all data in the application.Flux -> ReduxVictor Savkin - Angular Reactive - NGRX/store The global state is a big JavaScript object in memory. With redux there is just ONE global statefor the entire application.state - the current value of all meaningful variables in your application. - this means you won't have local variables much when doing this.{ counter: { current: 0 }}
